content:
You've got a solid plan in place to promote your behind-the-scenes live stream and poll across multiple channels!

By using a combination of social media, email newsletters, and in-stream promotions, you'll be able to reach a wider audience and build excitement for your live stream. Here are some additional suggestions to consider:

1. **Create a branded hashtag**: Develop a unique hashtag for your live stream and encourage your audience to use it when sharing their thoughts, questions, or feedback on social media. This will help you track the conversation and create a sense of community around your event.
2. **Share behind-the-scenes content**: As you mentioned, sharing behind-the-scenes content on social media can help build anticipation and give your audience a sneak peek into your preparation process. Consider sharing photos, videos, or Boomerangs that showcase your setup, rehearsals, or even your notes and research.
3. **Utilize Instagram Stories and IGTV**: Instagram Stories and IGTV can be great ways to share behind-the-scenes content, sneak peeks, and exclusive deals. You can also use the "swipe-up" feature to drive traffic to your poll or live stream.
4. **Collaborate with other creators**: Consider partnering with other creators or influencers in your niche to co-promote each other's content. This can help expand your reach and attract new audiences to your live stream.
5. **Offer exclusive content or incentives**: As you mentioned, offering exclusive content, discounts, or early access to your email subscribers can be a great way to incentivize them to participate in the poll and tune in to the live stream.
6. **Create a sense of urgency**: Use language like "limited time only" or "exclusive access" to create a sense of urgency around your live stream and poll. This can encourage your audience to participate and engage with your content.
7. **Monitor and respond to comments**: During your live stream and in the days leading up to it, make sure to monitor comments and respond to questions and feedback from your audience. This will help build a sense of community and engagement around your event.

By implementing these strategies, you'll be well on your way to creating a successful behind-the-scenes live stream and poll that engages your audience and builds anticipation for your upcoming live stream.

What's your plan for the actual live stream? Will you be using any specific equipment, software, or tools to enhance the viewing experience?
